wikipedia_page.main: Richard Shaw (6 August 1825 – 19 January 1876) was a British Liberal Party politician.

response: The constituency of Burnley elects a single member of Parliament (MP). Since the general election in 2019, the town has been represented by Antony Higginbotham, its first Conservative Party MP in over 100 years. The constituency had been represented by MPs of the Labour Party since 1935, apart from 2010 – 2015, when it was represented by Gordon Birtwistle, a Liberal Democrat. Richard Shaw was the town's first MP in 1868. Arguably its most notable MP was former leader of the Labour Party and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Arthur Henderson.
*Richard Shaw (Dorset MP) (fl. 1533–1563), MP for Poole, Melcombe Regis and Wareham
*Richard Shaw (Liberal politician) (1825–1876), British Member of Parliament for Burnley, 1868–1876
*Richard Shaw (footballer) (born 1968), English footballer and assistant manager at Coventry City
*Richard Shaw, British guitarist with Cradle of Filth
